document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Sadoletus Distant, with description of new species from China and Australia (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Heterogastridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Sadoletus Distant, with description of new species from China and Australia (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Heterogastridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Redescription. Following are additions to the original description ( Distant 1903 ), and description of
S. subpellucidus
given by Ban (2018) .
Abdomen ( Fig. 3 a–d): Median area of tergites I–VI with regular dense punctures; punctures on sternite VII with setae. Sternites I–V fused. Trichobothria on sternites III and IV almost linear.

Measurements. [ Paralectotype ♂ , another ♂ / Lectotype ♀ , another ♀ ]. Body length 4.83, 4.57 / 5.01, 5.25; maximum width across hemelytra 1.75, 1.53 / 1.75, 1.80; head length 0.76, 0.65 / 0.55, 0.71, head width across eyes 1.26, 1.15 / 1.31, 1.31; length of antennal segments I–IV respectively 0.32, 0.30 / 0.34, 0.39; 0.71, 0.67 / 0.67, 0.71; 0.55, 0.59 / 0.58, 0.62; 0.73, 0.76 / 0.83, 0.83; length of labial segments 0.55, 0.59 / 0.48, 0.69; 0.59, 0.64 / 0.55, 0.73; 0.50, 0.50 / 0.37, 0.58; 0.43, 0.46 / 0.30, 0.34; mesal pronotal length 1.08, 1.04 / 1.12, 1.20; anterior pronotal lobe length 0.46, 0.44 / 0.43, 0.46; posterior pronotal lobe length 0.58, 0.53 / 0.69, 0.73; anterior pronotal width 1.08, 0.98 / 1.15, 1.17; posterior pronotal width 1.56, 1.35 / 1.72, 1.68; mesal scutellar length 0.92, 0.81 / 1.05, 0.99; basal scutellar width 0.83, 0.77 / 1.03, 0.97; hemelytral length 3.22, 2.92 / 3.58, 3.33.

Types examined .
LECTOTYPE
, female, Peradeniya \ Ceylon , 12-1901 (hw) \\ Distant Coll. \ 1911-383 \\
Sadoletus \ validus
\ Dist. (hw) \\ type [label with red circle] \\ SYN- \ TYPE [label with blue circle] \\ BMNH(E) \ 1705350(NHM), designated here ( Fig. 1a, b ).
PARALECTOTYPE
, male, Mergui (hw) \\ Distant Coll. \ 1911-383 \\ SYN- \ TYPE [label with blue circle] \\ BMNH(E) \ 1705351(NHM), left antennal segment IV missing; right mid and left hind legs missing, genitalia dissected, designated here ( Fig. 1c, d ).

Sadoletus validus
\ det. J. A. Slater , 1979 ( NMNH )
.
Distribution. Sri Lanka ( Ceylon ), India , Laos ( Distant, 1903 ; Slater, 1964 ; Ban, 2018 ), in this study newly recorded from China ( Yunnan , Hainan , Guangxi , Taiwan) .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Types of
Sadoletus validus Distant, 1903
and their labels.
a, lectotype, female, dorsal view; b, same, lateral view; c, paralectotype, male, dorsal view; d, same, lateral view; e, paralectotype, pygophore, posterodorsal view; f–i, paralectotype, left paramere, four different aspects; j, lectotype, labels; k, paralectotype, labels. Abbreviations: mp, median projection.

FIGURE 2.
Sadoletus validus Distant, 1903
.
a, male, dorsal view; b, same, ventral view; c, female, dorsal view; d, same, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The adequate original description and illustrations by Ban (2018) allow doubtless recognition of
S. subpellucidus .
A careful study of the type specimens of
S. validus
, dissection of the genitalia of the male paralectotype , and comparison with the illustrations of
S. subpellucidus
showed they totally matched with each other, hence this synonymy established in the present contribution.
S. validus
is characterized by a pygophore with median projection with median longitudinal ridge, and anterolateral margin of median projection with horn-like outgrowth.
